problems.title: Single Number III (Bit Manipulation)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given an integer array nums, in which exactly two elements appear only once and all the other elements appear exactly twice. Find the two elements that appear only once. You can return the answer in any order.
You must write an algorithm that runs in linear runtime complexity and uses only constant extra space.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
1 2 1 3 2 5

Sample Output
3 5

Explanation: The two single numbers are 3 and 5. [5, 3] is also a valid answer.

Sample Input
-1 0

Sample Output
-1 0

Explanation: The two single numbers are -1 and 0.

Sample Input
0 1

Sample Output
0 1

Explanation: The two single numbers are 0 and 1.
problems.constraints:
2 <= nums.length <= 3 * 10^4
-2^31 <= nums[i] <= 2^31 - 1
Each integer in nums will appear twice, only two integers will appear once.
hintsList: XOR all numbers to get XOR of the two single numbers.
Find a bit that differs between the two numbers, then separate them into two groups.
